p: Thus, measuring the burden of disease attributable to dengue infection is imperative for understanding the potential impact of dengue control interventions and feasibility for vaccine introduction and evaluation. There are limited number of established longitudinal cohort studies characterizing dengue infection in Latin America. The aim of this study was to estimate age-specific attack rates, the proportion of inapparent infections, incidence rate ratios and assessing the covariates associated with arboviral infections and symptomatic disease in a prospective dengue cohort established in Yucatan, Mexico.
